results.adx_keywords: Hazardous and Toxic Substances;Railroad Accidents and Safety;Chemicals;Pollution;Evacuations and Evacuees;Norfolk Southern Corporation;Environmental Protection Agency;National Transportation Safety Board;East Palestine (Ohio)
results.title: What We Know About the Train Derailment in Ohio
results.abstract: On Feb. 3, a train derailed in the village of East Palestine, setting off evacuation orders, a toxic chemical scare and a federal investigation.

results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Fatalities);Michigan State University Shooting (Feb 13, 2023);Michigan State University;East Lansing (Mich)
results.title: What We Know About the Michigan State University Shooting
results.abstract: A gunman opened fire Monday night, killing three students and injuring five others. He was found off campus and died of a self-inflicted gunshot wound, the authorities said.

media.caption: The gunman opened fire in two buildings on the Michigan State University campus, the police said.
media.copyright: Emily Elconin for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;Presidential Election of 2024;Primaries and Caucuses;Indian-Americans;Haley, Nikki R;Trump, Donald J;Republican Party
results.title: Nikki Haley Is Running for President, the First G.O.P. Rival to Take On Trump
results.abstract: Ms. Haley, 51, a former South Carolina governor and a United Nations ambassador in the Trump administration, called for “generational change” in the party.

media.caption: Former Gov. Nikki Haley of South Carolina campaigning in September for Joe Lombardo in Las Vegas. He won the governor’s race in Nevada in November.
media.copyright: Saeed Rahbaran for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity;your-feed-visual-investigations;Humanitarian Aid;Reed, Pete (1989-2023);Bakhmut (Ukraine);Russia;Ukraine
results.byline: By Thomas Gibbons-Neff and Malachy Browne
results.title: Guided Missile Killed U.S. Aid Worker in Ukraine, Video Shows
results.abstract: A Times analysis suggests that an intentional strike, not an indiscriminate attack, most likely killed Pete Reed. It is unclear whether the attackers knew he was with a group of aid workers.
des_facet: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity

media.caption: Aid workers treating a wounded civilian in Bakhmut, Ukraine, on Feb. 2, an instant before a missile strike.

results.adx_keywords: Aviation Accidents, Safety and Disasters;Pilots;United Airlines;Air Line Pilots Assn;Federal Aviation Administration;National Transportation Safety Board;Maui (Hawaii);Pacific Ocean;San Francisco (Calif)
results.title: United Flight From Maui Came Within 800 Feet of Striking Pacific Ocean
results.abstract: The plane, a Boeing 777-200, climbed to 2,200 feet on Dec. 18 before entering a steep dive and falling at a rate of nearly 8,600 feet per minute, according to flight data.

media.caption: A United Airlines Boeing 777-200 landing at Heathrow International Airport outside London in 2019. A similar United jet entered a sharp dive shortly after leaving Maui on Dec. 18, according to flight data.

results.adx_keywords: Lotteries;Contests and Prizes;Castro, Edwin;Altadena (Calif);Los Angeles (Calif)
results.title: Winner of Record $2 Billion Powerball Jackpot Is Revealed
results.abstract: Edwin Castro was the only lottery player in the country to match all six numbers in the Nov. 7 Powerball drawing, earning him the largest payout in lottery history, California Lottery officials said.

media.caption: Alva Johnson, the California State Lottery director, announced on Tuesday that Edwin Castro had won the record-high $2.04 billion Powerball jackpot in November. Mr. Castro declined to appear at the news conference.

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;Feinstein, Dianne;Senate;Democratic Party;California
results.title: Senator Dianne Feinstein to Retire at the End of Her Term
results.abstract: The senator from California, who was first elected in 1992, plans to serve out her term but will not run for re-election in 2024.

media.caption: Senator Dianne Feinstein, Democrat of California, said in a statement on Tuesday that she would not seek re-election.

results.adx_keywords: Classified Information and State Secrets;United States Politics and Government;Special Prosecutors (Independent Counsel);Ethics and Official Misconduct;Corcoran, M Evan;Trump, Donald J;Smith, Jack (Attorney);Justice Department;National Archives and Records Administration
results.byline: By Alan Feuer, Maggie Haberman and Ben Protess
results.title: Prosecutors Seek Trump Lawyer’s Testimony, Suggesting Evidence of Crime
results.abstract: The Justice Department cited the crime-fraud exception to attorney-client privilege in demanding testimony from a lawyer representing former President Donald Trump in his documents case.

media.caption: The move by the Justice Department is the latest aggressive move by the special counsel investigating former President Donald J. Trump.

results.adx_keywords: Unidentified Flying Objects (UFO);United States Defense and Military Forces;United States Politics and Government;Espionage and Intelligence Services;Balloons (Aeronautics);North American Aerospace Defense Command;Canada;Alaska;China
results.byline: By Julian E. Barnes, Helene Cooper and Edward Wong
results.title: What’s Going On Up There? Theories but No Answers in Shootdowns of Mystery Craft.
results.abstract: The U.S. and Canada are investigating three unidentified flying objects shot down over North America in the past three days. Militaries have adjusted radars to try to spot more incursions.
des_facet: United States Defense and Military Forces

media.caption: The Pentagon and intelligence agencies have intensified their study of unexplained incidents near military bases in recent years.

results.adx_keywords: Espionage and Intelligence Services;Balloons (Aeronautics);Unidentified Flying Objects (UFO);United States Defense and Military Forces;North American Aerospace Defense Command
results.title: A Timeline of the U.F.O.s That Were Shot Down This Weekend
results.abstract: After a Chinese spy balloon was brought down this month, the U.S. has shot down at least three unidentified flying objects over the past few days.
des_facet: United States Defense and Military Forces

media.caption: After a Chinese spy balloon was shot down on Feb. 4, at least three unidentified objects have been shot down over North America.

results.adx_keywords: Sex;Dating and Relationships;Loneliness;Men and Boys;Women and Girls;Polls and Public Opinion;internal-sub-only;United States
results.title: Have More Sex, Please!
results.abstract: America is in the midst of a loneliness epidemic. One solution: People should have more sex — as often as they can, as pleasurably as they can.

results.adx_keywords: Marriages;Dating and Relationships;Sleep;Love (Emotion);Snoring;internal-sub-only;United States
results.title: I Love You, but I Don’t Want to Sleep With You
results.abstract: Snoring and conflicting schedules are top reasons couples decide to sleep in separate bedrooms. Sex therapists and marriage counselors have their doubts about the arrangement.

media.caption: Cara and Rich Newhart began sleeping apart at the beginning of the pandemic and stuck with the arrangement when they bought a new house in New Jersey.

results.adx_keywords: Love (Emotion);Dating and Relationships;Psychology and Psychologists;internal-sub-only;Aron, Arthur (1945- )
results.title: The 36 Questions That Lead to Love
results.abstract: A series of personal questions used by the psychologist Arthur Aron to explore the idea of fostering closeness through mutual vulnerability.

results.adx_keywords: Elderly;Population;Suicides and Suicide Attempts;Euthanasia and Assisted Suicide;Colleges and Universities;Content Type: Personal Profile;internal-sub-only;Discrimination;Economics (Theory and Philosophy);Narita, Yusuke;Yale University;Japan
results.byline: By Motoko Rich and Hikari Hida
results.title: A Yale Professor Suggested Mass Suicide for Old People in Japan. What Did He Mean?
results.abstract: Yusuke Narita says he is mainly addressing a growing effort to revamp Japan’s age-based hierarchies. Still, he has pushed the country’s hottest button.

media.caption: Yusuke Narita, wearing his signature eyeglasses with one round and one square lens. He said his comments about mass suicide and the elderly had been “taken out of context.”
media.copyright: Bea Oyster for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Television;Colbert, Stephen;Fallon, Jimmy;Kimmel, Jimmy;Meyers, Seth
results.title: Late Night Recaps Rihanna’s Super Bowl Halftime Surprise
results.abstract: Jimmy Kimmel called the pop singer’s pregnancy reveal “the biggest ‘we’re expecting’ announcement in the history of the world.”

media.caption: Jimmy Kimmel joked that Rihanna “closed the show by shooting down one of those U.F.O.s.”

results.adx_keywords: Baseball;Sailboats and Sailing;Content Type: Personal Profile;Jaso, John (1983- );Tampa Bay Rays;Seattle Mariners;Pittsburgh Pirates
results.title: No More Spring Trainings
results.abstract: John Jaso walked away from Major League Baseball at 34, potentially leaving millions of dollars on the table. The sea was calling.

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;Presidential Election of 2024;Haley, Nikki R;Trump, Donald J;Republican Party;South Carolina
results.title: Nikki Haley Threw It All Away
results.abstract: No political figure better illustrates the tragic collapse of the modern Republican Party than the former governor of South Carolina.

media.caption: By the time Ms. Haley resigned as ambassador to the United Nations, she had undergone a remarkable transformation.
media.copyright: Samuel Corum for The New York Times

results.title: Spirited Away to Miyazaki Land
results.abstract: What happens when the surreal imagination of the world’s greatest living animator, Hayao Miyazaki, is turned into a theme park?

media.caption: A Totoro-like climbing structure.

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;Ethics and Official Misconduct;Campaign Finance;internal-sub-only;Santos, George (1988- );House of Representatives;Republican Party;Federal Election Commission;WinRed;New York State
results.byline: By Grace Ashford, Alexandra Berzon, Ken Bensinger and Alyce McFadden
results.title: George Santos and the Case of the Missing $365,000
results.abstract: Representative George Santos’s failure to account for hundreds of thousands of dollars in spending is part of a pattern of irregularities in the way his campaign handled its finances.

media.caption: Among the discrepancies found in Representative George Santos’s campaign filings was an extraordinarily high fee payment to WinRed, a digital platform that processes donations.
